thread.title: Paksi SE's Laszlo Bartha scores back-heel wonder volley in Hungarian top tier
thread.title_full: Paksi SE's Laszlo Bartha scores back-heel wonder volley in Hungarian top tier

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Paksi SE's Laszlo Bartha scores back-heel wonder volley in Hungarian top tier
text:
Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Over the years we've seen some sensational back-heel volleys. 
In 2014, we were blessed to witness this incredible (yet strangely hilarious) 35-yard strike. 
In 2016, we watched PSG U19 starlet Samuel Essende produce this cheeky effort. 
And as recently as last month we saw Francesco Nicastro produce an outrageous spinning back-heel goal. 
Adding his name to this esteemed collection is Paksi SE's Laszlo Bartha. The midfielder plies his trade in the Hungarian top tier and certainly caught everyone's eye on Saturday. Bartha improvises from the corner (Photo: AS TV) 
2-1 up against home side Debrecen, Paksi SE win a corner in the 84th minute. 
After coming on as a substitute 13 minutes prior, Bartha well and truly puts himself in the mix. A clean connection helps Bartha score (Photo: AS TV) 
And it pays off, Bartha latches onto the set-piece flicking his heel at the ball sending it into the far corner of the goal. 
It's an outstanding effort, and well worthy of a Puskas Award nomination. poll loading Is Laszlo Bartha's goal the best back-heel volley you've ever seen? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
